intro: Sticherus gnidioides, commonly known as the knotted rock-rush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Sticherus gnidioides is well adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its succulent leaves and deep root system.
